channel.title: math.RA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.RA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Finite Gr\"obner bases for quantum symmetric groups
item.description: arXiv:2503.15104v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Non-commutative Gr\"obner bases of two-sided ideals are not necessarily finite. Motivated by this, we provide a closed-form description of a finite and reduced Gr\"obner bases for the two-sided ideal used in the construction of Wangs quantum symmetric group. In particular, this proves that the word problem for quantum symmetric groups is decidable.
item.dc:creator: Leonard Schmitz, Marcel Wack

item.title: Compatible root graded anti-pre-Lie algebraic structures on finite-dimensional complex simple Lie algebras
item.description: arXiv:2503.15241v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We investigate the compatible root graded anti-pre-Lie algebraic structures on any finite-dimensional complex simple Lie algebra by the representation theory of ${\rm sl_2(\C)}$. We show that there does not exist a compatible root graded anti-pre-Lie algebraic structure on a finite-dimensional complex simple Lie algebra except ${\rm sl_2(\C)}$, whereas there is exactly one compatible root graded anti-pre-Lie algebraic structure on ${\rm sl_2(\C)}$.
item.dc:creator: Chengming Bai, Dongfang Gao

item.title: Geometric interpretation of valuated term (pre)orders
item.description: arXiv:2306.05538v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Valuated term orders are studied for the purposes of Gr\"{o}bner theory over fields with valuation. The points of a usual tropical variety correspond to certain valuated terms preorders. Generalizing both of these, the set of all ``well-behaved'' valuated term preorders is canonically in bijection with the points of a space introduced in our previous work on tropical adic geometry. In this paper we interpret these points geometrically by explicitly characterizing them in terms of classical polyhedral geometry. This characterization gives a bijection with equivalence classes of flags of polyhedra as well as a bijection with a class of prime filters on a lattice of polyhedral sets. The first of these also classifies valuated term orders. The second bijection is of the same flavor as the bijections from [van der Put and Schneider, 1995] in non-archimedean analytic geometry and indicates that the results of that paper may have analogues in tropical adic geometry.
item.dc:creator: Netanel Friedenberg, Kalina Mincheva

item.title: Diophantine enumeration of Dynkin friezes
item.description: arXiv:2503.08800v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove the Fontaine-Plamondon conjecture and show that there are precisely $4400$ and $26952$ positive integral $E_7$-friezes and $E_8$-friezes respectively, completing the enumerative classification of all positive integral friezes of Dynkin type. We also give new Diophantine proofs of the enumeration theorems for friezes of all other Dynkin types, which were previously proved using discrete geometry, algebraic combinatorics, and the theory of cluster algebras. In general, we count Dynkin friezes of rank $n$ by determining the positive integral points on certain $n$-dimensional affine varieties with infinitely many integral points.
item.dc:creator: Robin Zhang
